pull.title: doc: update tor.md, release notes with removal of tor v2 support
pull.body: Follow-up documentation to #22050 that removed support for Tor version 2 hidden services from Bitcoin Core.

events.message: doc: update tor.md with removal of tor v2 support

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* #21158 (lib: Add Taproot support to libconsensus by jrawsthorne)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

events.message: doc: update release notes with removal of tor v2 support

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -18,7 +26,7 @@ information in the debug log about your Tor configuration.
 CLI `-addrinfo` returns the number of addresses known to your node per network
 type, including Tor v2 and v3. This is useful to see how many onion addresses
comments.body:
Since #22050, and for Bitcoin Core 22.0, our node shouldn't know of Torv2 addresses. So this should be updated. 

```suggestion
type. This is useful to see how many onion addresses
```

```
$ ./src/bitcoin-cli -addrinfo

{
  "addresses_known": {
    "ipv4": 11975,
    "ipv6": 2395,
    "torv2": 0,
    "torv3": 10,
    "i2p": 0,
    "total": 14380
  }
}
```

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -18,7 +26,7 @@ information in the debug log about your Tor configuration.
 CLI `-addrinfo` returns the number of addresses known to your node per network
 type, including Tor v2 and v3. This is useful to see how many onion addresses
comments.body: Hmm, and there is the same info in the release notes for -addrinfo. For now, -addrinfo returns "torv2" and "torv3", so my thought was that this should be updated when -addrinfo is changed to return only "onion" instead, probably for v23. WDYT? (thanks for having a look!)

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -18,7 +26,7 @@ information in the debug log about your Tor configuration.
 CLI `-addrinfo` returns the number of addresses known to your node per network
 type, including Tor v2 and v3. This is useful to see how many onion addresses
comments.body: yeah, makes sense. Can be left for a followup

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -59,6 +59,15 @@ Notable changes
 P2P and network changes
 -----------------------
 
+- This release removes support for Tor version 2 hidden services in favor of Tor
+  v3 only, as the Tor network [dropped support for Tor
+  v2](https://blog.torproject.org/v2-deprecation-timeline) with the release of
+  Tor version 0.4.6.  Henceforth, Bitcoin Core ignores Tor v2 addresses; it
+  neither rumors them over the network to other peers nor stores them in memory
+  or to `peers.dat`.  Tor v2 addresses are ignored by
+  `contrib/seeds/generate-seeds.py` and have been removed from the hard-coded
comments.body: I don't think changes to maintainer-facing tools such as `generate-seeds` need to be in the release notes. Not a big deal though.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -59,6 +59,15 @@ Notable changes
 P2P and network changes
 -----------------------
 
+- This release removes support for Tor version 2 hidden services in favor of Tor
+  v3 only, as the Tor network [dropped support for Tor
+  v2](https://blog.torproject.org/v2-deprecation-timeline) with the release of
+  Tor version 0.4.6.  Henceforth, Bitcoin Core ignores Tor v2 addresses; it
+  neither rumors them over the network to other peers nor stores them in memory
+  or to `peers.dat`.  Tor v2 addresses are ignored by
+  `contrib/seeds/generate-seeds.py` and have been removed from the hard-coded
comments.body:
Good point, removed.

FWIW if #22179 is merged, I planned to append its PR number to this entry manually in the wiki.
